Created by: Adam K
Email: adam@everythingandroid.net
Blog: http://www.everythingandroid.net

SMS Popup is a simple application that shows a dialog when an SMS is received - turning on the screen and unlocking the keyguard if needed. It shows the most recent message, who it's from and the contact picture if available.

Feel free to email me any comments, suggestions or bugs.

German translation by: Feyyaz A.
Email: f_alingan@hotmail.com
Website: http://www.yenio.com

Dutch translation by: mellie@xs4all.nl

Spanish translation by: Diego Fernández
Email: profediego@gmail.com

Russian translation by: Artem Kavalerov
Email: artem.kavalerov@gmail.com

Credits to Min Tran for the app icon.
(http://min.frexy.com)
See what\'s new in this version
E-mail comments or bugs to the developer
Can I include your system information in the e-mail (this will help me troubleshoot bugs easier)?
The screen will sleep after this time
Popup screen will be dim (saves battery)
Popup will show all message details
Message sender name will also be hidden
Message sender name will be shown

Only use privacy mode when screen is locked
Messages will be marked as read when clicking \"Close\"
Messages will not be marked as read when clicking \"Close\"
Popup window will only show when keyguard is engaged
Buttons will be hidden till screen is unlocked
Choose the application that is launched for multiple messages
Note that the "Reply" messaging application is set by the system
Buttons are hidden in long press menu
The background behind the message window will be blurred out
The background behind the message window will not be blurred
Display message notifications in status bar

To avoid conflicts and multiple alerts, please disable the system SMS notifications and any other apps that provide a notification when a SMS is received.\n\nTo turn off the system notification, go to the messaging app, hit menu -> settings and un-check notifications.
Show pop up for this contact
This sound will play when a message is received

Sound will not play while on a call

Enter a custom vibrate pattern, in the format:
millisOff, millisOn, etc.

For example:
0,1000
0,500,200,500,200,500
Blink LED when a message is received
Do not blink LED when a message is received
Set the speed the LED blinks
Custom LED blink rate is invalid
Enter the time in milliseconds to turn the LED on and off
The time period between notification reminders
The number of reminder notifications to play
Reminders will turn screen on again
Reminders will not turn screen on
Warning - turning the screen on for reminders can significantly affect battery life
Notifications for all contacts without an individual customization
Customize pop up for each contact

SMS Popup now offers the ability to customize notifications on a per contact basis. When a new message comes in, SMS Popup will first check if the contact has a customized notification. If so, those settings are used, otherwise the default notifications are used.\n\nUsing this functionality, you could set things up so only a few contacts show a popup while the rest trigger a regular notification. You could also ignore certain contacts by setting their notification to silent.
Configure preset texts for quick replies
Voice recognition not available on this device
SMS Popup is a free application that I work on in my spare time. If you find it useful, and can spare a few bucks, a donation would be much appreciated.\n\nThanks!
